name: fattureincloud/fattureincloud-php-sdk
description: ## Request informations In every request description you will be able to find some additional informations about context, permissions and supported functionality:  | Parameter | Description | |-----------|-------------| | ðŸ‘¥ Context | Indicate the subject of the request. Can be `company`, `user` or `accountant`.  | | ðŸ”’ Required scope | If present, indicates the required scope to fulfill the request. | | ðŸ” Filtering | If present, indicates which fields support the filtering feature. | | â†•ï¸ Sorting | If present, indicates which fields support the sorting feature. | | ðŸ“„ Paginated results | If present, indicate that the results are paginated. | | ðŸŽ© Customized responses supported | If present, indicate that you can use `field` or `fieldset` to customize the response body. |  For example the request `GET /entities/{entityRole}` have tis informations: \ ðŸ‘¥ Company context \ ðŸ”’ Required scope: `entity.clients:r` or `entity.suppliers:r` (depending on `entityRole`) \ ðŸ” Filtering: `id`, `name` \ â†•ï¸ Sorting: `id`, `name` \ ðŸ“„ Paginated results \ ðŸŽ© Customized responses supported  Keep in mind that if you are making **company realted requests**, you will need to specify the company id in the requests: ``` GET /c/{company_id}/issued_documents ```
